oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Major Ridge portrait
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color portrait of Major Ridge. Portrait from shoulders up. He wears a blue coat, brown vest, black necktie, and white color. He has short, white hair. Printed name below. Major Ridge A Cherokee Chief
Fought with the U.S. during the War of 1812. Reluctantly supported Indian removal in the 1830s, after initially opposing it. He was killed by disgruntled Cherokees in 1839.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Ridge, Major, approximately 1771-1839
Ridge, Major, approximately 1771-1839;Cherokee Nation. Treaties, etc. United States, 1835 December 29;Cherokee
Indians of North America;Tribal chiefs
